intro: Alsine falcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in desert scrub and coastal dunes, where it thrives in full sun. Alsine falcata is an annual species that completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
